duties_responsibilities.duty: Strategically design and implement in-house information systems and networked software architecture to support core organizational functions.
Provide architectural governance over systems and software plans, evaluate and select technologies required for implementation.
Establish and define architectural principals across the enterprise, provide technical leadership and consulting.
Research, develop, document, recommend, and communicate plans for investing in systems architecture.
Work closely with Project Managers, business users, and stakeholders to understand functional and technical aspects of projects.
Develop and manage a systems capacity plan including key performance metrics documented.
Review new and existing IT projects and systems designs for compliance with IT standards and architectural plans.
Understand interoperability issues and the strengths and weaknesses of platforms and products.
Model business and systems processes based on findings through use cases, workflow diagrams, and data models.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems management or related field (Master's preferred)
